children.subject: We're not teaching the class this semester, but it's not worth if if you've already taken Data 100.
Is this class meant to be a bridge between Data 8 and Data 100? If I have taken Data 100 already, would this class be worth taking then?

history.content:
Hey everyone, my name is Kyle and I am a facilitator for DATA 198 this semester! 

 

Data 198 is a 2-unit DeCal that aims to build a bridge between the Data 8 curriculum and hands-on data science through the completion of a personal capstone project. The course will translate knowledge of the datascience package to the pandas library, and give students supplemental technical skills to support their own data analysis projects. 

 

If you want to gain some more experience working on data science projects from start to finish and dive further into industry-standard tools and techniques, consider signing up for Data 198! It is intended for students who have just completed Data 8 and plan to study all fields that involve working with data. Methods such as finding robust datasets, dealing with missing values, and assessing the validity of the analysis will be taught. Upon completing this course, you will be able to use industry-grade data science tools to analyze data for projects in all fields!

If you want more information, please check out our course website here: https://ds-modules.github.io/DATA198-SP21.github.io/ (Note: website is not fully up to date yet, but the instructors on the front page are correct.) 

If you are interested, please fill out this non-binding interest form here: https://forms.gle/2QK6Sx9rJ5WF5chX9

Additionally, feel free to message me or any of the listed instructors if you have any further questions. Thanks!
history.subject: Data 198: Applied Data Science for Research and Discovery
